III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
At the time of the onsite visit the office space that is to be utilized was undergoing
renovations. The office space at 4008 W. Wackerly, Midland, MI 48640 is newly leased
space. It consists of two rooms located in a small office complex. The first room is a
small reception area with a doorway leading to a small hall. The hall leads to a large
room that will be more than adequate to meet the early needs of this child placing
agency. Although the office furniture was not in place the desks were identified and
locked cabinets are provided for all confidential records.
B. Program Description
Adoption Option, Inc. is a new child placing agency licensed by the State of Michigan for
evaluating homes for adoptions, supervising adoptive placements, certifying homes for
foster care licensure, placing children in foster homes, and supervising independent
living.
The priority for this program is the evaluation of families for adoptive placements and
the supervision of adoptive placements. It is the desire of the program administrator to
evaluate and match prospective adoptive families with permanent state wards that are
registered in the MARE book to achieve permanence in a timelier manner. The other
child placing activities and terms are initially in place to serve in a support role for this
priority as needed.
Initial services will be provided through the use of contractual individuals with
qualifications consistent with the services and in compliance with the applicable
licensing rules. The individuals that are projected to provide these services meet the
qualifications and standards established by the applicable licensing rules.
2

C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The proposed policies and procedures are in compliance with all applicable licensing
rules at this time.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is the recommendation of this consultant that Adoption Option, Inc. be issued a 1st
provisional license as a child placing agency with the terms to certify foster homes
for licensure, receive children for placement in licensed foster homes, supervise
independent living placements, evaluate applicants for adoption and place and
supervise children with adoptive parents.
